title: Total US Jobs Lost to AI as % of Labor Force
description: Projected net jobs eliminated by AI and automation as a share of the total US civilian labor force (~168.5 million). Only data points with directly sourced figures are plotted.

overlays.label: Brookings: 6.1M workers (4.2%) face high AI exposure + low adaptive capacity

sources.title: The Potentially Large Effects of AI on Economic Growth
sources.excerpt: Roughly two-thirds of current jobs are exposed to some degree of AI automation; generative AI could substitute up to one-fourth of current work.

sources.title: OECD Employment Outlook 2023: AI and the Labour Market
sources.excerpt: 27% of jobs are in occupations at high risk, but actual displacement depends on adoption speed and policy response.

sources.title: Gen-AI: Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Work
sources.excerpt: Almost 40% of global employment is exposed to AI; in advanced economies, roughly 60% of workers face some degree of AI impact.

sources.title: The Simple Macroeconomics of AI
sources.excerpt: AI may increase TFP by only 0.53-0.66% over 10 years; limited net job losses of ~2% as many affected tasks are only partially automated.

sources.title: Future of Jobs Report 2024
sources.excerpt: Employers expect 23% of jobs to change in the next five years, with a net decline of 2-4% of total roles once job creation offsets displacement.

sources.title: AI And Automation Will Take 6% Of US Jobs By 2030
sources.excerpt: Forrester estimates 6% of US jobs will be lost to AI and automation by 2030, partially offset by new job creation.

sources.title: AI exposure predicts unemployment risk
sources.excerpt: Workers in AI-exposed occupations face significantly higher unemployment risk, suggesting aggregate job losses may exceed earlier estimates.

sources.title: We're not ready for mass AI unemployment
Bureau of Labor Statistics Employment Projections 2024-2034
AI was behind over 50,000 layoffs in 2025
sources.excerpt: Challenger, Gray & Christmas reports AI has been cited as the reason for 54,694 planned layoffs in 2025. Overall job cuts topped 1 million in 2025.

sources.title: US Job Postings Are 15% Below Peak â€” AI Categories Hit Hardest
sources.excerpt: Data entry (-27%), customer service (-18%), and basic admin (-22%) postings saw steepest declines. AI/ML postings +42% YoY.

sources.title: C-Suite Survey on AI and Employment: Early Evidence
sources.excerpt: Survey of 2,500 C-suite executives finds 90% report no significant net employment impact from AI adoption as of Q3 2025, though task reallocation is widespread.

sources.title: Challenger Report: 55,000 AI-Attributed Layoffs in 2025
sources.excerpt: Employers cited AI as a direct cause for 55,000 job cuts in 2025, concentrated in customer service, data entry, and back-office operations.

sources.title: The Projected Impact of Generative AI on Future Productivity Growth
sources.excerpt: Roughly 10% of US work affected in the short run; AI will increase productivity and GDP by 1.5% by 2035. Jobs that AI can completely replace saw 0.75% employment fall 2021-2024.

sources.title: Evaluating the Impact of AI on the Labor Market: Current State of Affairs
sources.publisher: Yale Budget Lab (Gimbel, Kinder, Kendall, Lee)
sources.excerpt: No economy-wide employment disruption tied to AI since ChatGPT's debut. Measures of AI exposure show no clear relationship with changes in employment or unemployment.

sources.title: The Unequal Adoption of ChatGPT Exacerbates Existing Inequalities Among Workers
sources.excerpt: Half of workers in exposed occupations have used ChatGPT; younger, male, higher-achieving workers lead adoption. Women 16pp less likely to use for work.

sources.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
sources.excerpt: 2.5% of US employment at risk of displacement from current AI use cases; 60% of current US workers in occupations that didn't exist in 1940.

sources.title: How Will AI Affect the Global Workforce?
sources.excerpt: AI could displace 6-7% of the US workforce if widely adopted. We remain skeptical that AI will lead to large employment reductions over the next decade.

sources.title: AI Labor Market Impact: Freelancers
sources.excerpt: More than half of businesses using freelancers in 2022 have stopped entirely; freelance marketplace spend fell from 0.66% to 0.14% of total business spend.

sources.title: Measuring US workers' capacity to adapt to AI-driven job displacement
sources.excerpt: 6.1 million workers (4.2% of the workforce in our sample) work in occupations that are both highly exposed and where workers have low expected adaptive capacity.
